ygData.subject: RE: Dark Bargainers Faction
ygData.msgSnippet: Have you tried just giving the items to the NPC instead of hailing them and going through the dialogue? The reason I ask this is as follows.  I have a 22
ygData.messageBody:
Have you tried just giving the items to the NPC instead of hailing them and
going through the dialogue?

The reason I ask this is as follows. I have a 22 Erudite Wiz who began the
Stein of Moggok quest (an enchanter friend was going to finish the quest for
him). There comes a time in that quest when you need to travel to Rivervale
to get a bottle of Honeyjum. My wizard was dubious to the npc giving out
the honeyjum. Whenever he hailed the npc, the npc REFUSED to talk to him.
However, he could give the npc the 3 honeycombs and 30 gold pieces and get
the honeyjum! Even though he couldn't initiate the quest through dialogue
(due to very bad faction) he could STILL complete the quest just by turning
in the items.

I realize you may have already tried this, so just take this message as an
"in case you haven't already..." type of deal.

Mujahid 17 Necro Sol Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Fottral, Mayo [mailto:mayof@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, February 23, 2000 2:08 PM
> To: 'EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Dark Bargainers Faction
>
>
> From: "Fottral, Mayo" <mayof@...>
>
> To all telling me to do the Red Wine quest, I have tried (and tried, and
> tried, and tried) but you CAN'T do it unless you are indifferent
> or better.
> I am one notch down from indifferent at apprehensive, and at apprehensive
> (or dubious I assume) you cannot do the red wine quest OR the
> Lightstone/Research quest with the DE merchant in S. Ro. So if anyone has
> any other quest that is possible to do at apprehensive that gives good
> factions towards the Dark Bargainers, I would be extremely
> grateful. Thanks
> again!
>
> - Xinuilt
>
